resources.name: D-Center
resources.description: The D Center is a space and community where students can celebrate disability and D/deaf pride and foster community at the UW and beyond

resources.alt: Cherry blossom trees in the quad at UW. Campus building in the background behind the trees.
resources.name: UW Facilities - Accessible Routes
resources.description: The UW is committed to ensuring access and inclusion for all. This website is our information hub to help community members with disabilities navigate the campus.

resources.name: Disability Parking
resources.description: Disability Parking is an accommodation that allows the student to purchase a long-term Disability Parking Permit for an assigned lot on the relevant campus through the relevant campus Transportation Services office.

resources.alt: Two people sitting at a desk. The two people are looking at papers on the desk. The older blonde woman is instructing a women brunette woman.
resources.name: The Learn Clinic
resources.description: The LEARN Clinic is a self-sustained specialty clinic within the University of Washington’s Psychological Services and Training Clinic.

resources.alt: Disability resources for students logo. Text is set on a picture of mount rainier
resources.name: DRS - Disability Resource Center
resources.description: An organization within UW, providing support, accommodations, and resources to individuals with disabilities, ensuring access and inclusion for all students with disabilities.

resources.name: Disability Studies UW
resources.description: Disability Studies is a multi-disciplinary field that investigates, critiques, and enhances Western society’s understandings of disability.

resources.alt: graphic design of a computer with with a human icon on it. Above the computer are 3 more icons, a gear and a human profile, an eyeball, and an ear. Below the computer is two hands opening to that the computer is visible
resources.name: UW Common Accommodations
resources.description: Common accommodations for UW students to explore on campus.

resources.alt: Pupsupport club logo. Two cartoon dogs facing eachother, with one with its back ot the camera. The light grey dog facing the camera is laughing and the dark grey dog with its back to the camera has a comment icon next to it with a heart inside.
resources.name: PupSupport
resources.description: Pup Support is a student-led organization with a focus on providing mental health resources to college students creatively. They help break the barriers that college students face with their mental health and ultimately help our community sustain and develop healthy mental health skills.

resources.name: Best Buddies
resources.description: Best Buddies International is an international nonprofit dedicated to establishing a global movement that creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, leadership development, and inclusive living for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD).

resources.name: Alliance for Disability Law and Justice
resources.description: The Alliance for Disability Law and Justice (ADLJ) at UW Law advocates for a more inclusive, accessible, and holistic approach to law school from a foundation of anti-racism, intersectionality, and anti-ableism.

resources.name: Ability
resources.description: Ability's goal is to create disability community and accessibility awareness within the computing community. Our club is open to all UW students, but based in the Allen School for Computer Science & Engineering. The computing community at UW is a tight-knit community.

resources.name: UW ASL Club
resources.description: We bring Deaf, hard-of-hearing, and hearing students together by communicating in sign language, learning about the Deaf culture, and providing support to the Deaf community.

resources.name: Huskies for Neurodiversity
resources.description: Huskies for Neurodiversity is a student-led initiative that promotes visibility and acceptance of neurodiversity at UW campus and beyond through articles, lived experience interviews with neurodivergent people, interactive website, and panel events.

resources.name: ASUW Student Disability Comission
resources.description: The SDC is a student-led disability advocacy organization housed under ASUW. The SDC puts on events addressing relevant topics within the Disability community, and advocates on campus for greater access for disabled students.

resources.name: School of Social Work Disability Justice Collective
resources.description: The SSW Disability Justice Collective is a student group within the School of Social Work that strives to create a community driven space to share experiences around disability. We seek to provide a platform for support between disabled SSW students, and advocate for disability justice and community care within the school.

resources.name: Autistics @ UW
resources.description: We hope to provide a friendly and accessible social space for UW students who are Autistic or questioning if they are Autistic. It is a way for Autistic/questioning students to make friends with others on the spectrum and participate in social events that are designed to be aware of their needs.

resources.name: DASA - Disability Advocacy Student Alliance
resources.description: DASA is a student group facilitated for and by students. Our goal is to address the needs and concern of the disability community and its allies on the University of Washington campus regarding the issue of disability. We aim to represent student interest while working with allied student groups, UW administration and the off campus community.

resources.name: DO-IT - Disabilities, Opportunities, Internetworking, and Technology
resources.description: The DO-IT (Disabilities, Opportunities, Internetworking, and Technology) Center is dedicated to empowering people with disabilities through technology and education. It promotes awareness and accessibility—in both the classroom and the workplace—to maximize the potential of individuals with disabilities and make our communities more vibrant, diverse, and inclusive.

resources.name: Husky ADAPT - Accessible Design and Play Technology
resources.description: Husky ADAPT is a student organization at the University of Washington, Seattle campus that is dedicated to supporting accessible design and inclusive play technology. We train the next generation of inclusively-minded engineers, clinicians, and educators to help make the world a more equitable place.

resources.name: Quartet Health
resources.description: Quartet offers personalized care navigation services and connects individuals with mental health providers and resources to improve their overall well-being.

resources.name: Society for Neurodiversity
resources.description: S4Nd’s peer support groups are run by and for neurodiverse people. The groups offer members mutual support, guidance and the sharing of information. All S4Nd peer support groups are open to anyone who identifies as neurodiverse.

resources.name: Disability Community Resource Center
resources.description: Various support groups and resources for individuals with disabilities offering both virtual and in-person options.

resources.name: Better Help
resources.description: BetterHelp is an online therapy platform that provides accessible mental health services to individuals seeking support for various concerns such as depression, anxiety, relationship issues, etc. Therapy is offered through messaging, live chat, phone calls, and video sessions, allowing users to communicate with licensed therapists at their own pace and convenience.

resources.name: Meetup
resources.description: Meet other local people interested in neurodiversity and disabilities: share experiences, inspire and encourage each other! Join a neurodiversity and or disability group.

resources.name: Alma
resources.description: Alma is a community of independent mental health care providers. While our team helps you navigate the search process, we don’t prescribe the rest. Each provider at Alma sets their own rates and makes their own decisions about going in-network with major insurance payers.

resources.name: Psychology Today
resources.description: An online platform that covers a wide range of topics related to psychology, mental health, and well-being. Features articles, blogs, news, and expert insights on various psychological topics, including therapy, relationships, self-improvement, and mental health conditions. Provides directories of therapists, psychiatrists, support groups, and treatment centers to help individuals find mental health resources in the area.
